channel.title: Grace Church Cary Podcasts
channel.description: Welcome to Grace Church in Cary, North Carolina 3725 Kildaire Farm Road Cary, NC 27512 Pastor Rob Keffer Associate Pastor Nate Marriner Visit our website at www.gracechurchcary.com
channel.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
channel.itunes:summary: Welcome to Grace Church in Cary, North Carolina. Located at: 3725 Kildaire Farm Road Cary, NC 27512 Pastor Rob Keffer Associate Pastor Nate Marriner Visit our website at http://www.gracechurchcary.com

item.title: 5 Easy Steps to Wreck Your Life - Part 1: How to Commit Adultery
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: 5 Easy Steps to Wreck Your Life - Part 1: How to Commit Adultery
item.itunes:summary: This week, Pastor Rob begins a new sermon series entitled "5 Easy Steps to Wreck Your Life." People don't set out to commit adultery and wreck their life. There's usually a sequence of behaviors that occur that lead up to infidelity. Pastor Rob gives us insight into avoiding these behaviors and being intentional about actions that can strengthen our marriage. Reference: Exodus 20:14
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Freedom
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Freedom
item.itunes:summary: Because of God's grace, we are forgiven and free. We are free from guilt, shame, condemnation, and judgment. We are free from the penalty of sin and the power of sin. In Galations, Paul reminds us not use this freedom to indulge our sinful nature, but rather to serve one another in love. Reference: Galatians 5:1,13-15
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Fences
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Fences
item.itunes:summary: Jesus came into this world to love it and to teach us how to love it; however, we tend to try to put up fences around the people we want to love, leaving out many people. This is not what Jesus wants from us. He wants us to tear down those fences and show God's love to anyone and everyone. Reference: Luke 10:25-29
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Dangerously Busy
item.itunes:author: Rose Boyd
item.itunes:subtitle: Dangerously Busy
item.itunes:summary: Guest speaker, Rose Boyd, brings a special Mother's Day message about the dangers of being too busy to remember that we are here to live for God and please Him. Reference: Luke 10
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Parenthood - Part 4: What Do We Do Now?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate Marriner
item.itunes:subtitle: Parenthood - Part 4: What Do We Do Now?
item.itunes:summary: Being a parent is not easy. Many times, despite our best efforts, our children rebel. What should we as parents do in this case? How do we pray for them? Reference: Luke 15:11-16,20
item.itunes:keywords: Prodigal, Rebel, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Parenthood - Part 3: Discipline
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Parenthood - Part 3: Discipline
item.itunes:summary: As parents, we need to discipline our children in love, modeling the way in which God disciplines His children. The Bible says that if we do not do this, then we are leading our child into a negative and destructive destiny. Reference: Hebrews 12:5-6
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Parenthood - Part 2: Unchanging Principles of Parenting
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Parenthood - Part 2: Unchanging Principles of Parenting
item.itunes:summary: This week, Pastor Rob continues the series on Parenthood with a study from Mark where Jesus provides us with three unchanging principles for great relationships. Reference: Mark 10:13-16
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Parenthood - Part 1: The Parent's Priority
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Parenthood - Part 1: The Parent's Priority
item.itunes:summary: As a parent, our priority is to gradually transfer our child's dependence away from us until it rests solely on God. This week, Pastor Rob begins a new series entitled Parenthood by presenting steps that allow us to make this priority a reality in our lives. Reference: Deuteronomy 6:1-2, 4-5, 6-9
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Easter Message
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter Message
item.itunes:summary: Don't let your life be defined by the awfulness of Friday. Sunday is the promise of a new day. Let your life be defined by Jesus who rose again in power victorious over death, hell, and the grave. That's the Sunday that Jesus gave us, and we don't have to live in the shadow of Friday. Reference: John 19:28-30
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Re-think Greatness
item.itunes:author: Austin Mathews, Dean Bangera, Kevin Resurreccion
item.itunes:subtitle: Re-think Greatness
item.itunes:summary: Jesus' example on what we celebrate as Palm Sunday shows us that greatness isn't determined by wealth, fame or accomplishments. In contrast, greatness is about what you give. Jesus said that to be great you have to serve, just as he served us and gave us the ultimate gift by dying on the cross. Reference: Matthew 21:5-9
item.itunes:keywords: Palm, Sunday, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Unpacking Love - Part 2
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Unpacking Love - Part 2
item.itunes:summary: People who are hungry for love usually make being loved their goal. Inevitably they settle for something tainted and corrupt that ends in a sick heart and spirit. That explains the heartache many people suffer over and over again. They take something good and make it the greatest thing in their life. It becomes their god. This sounds strange, but it is true. You can put love in place of God. Love can be your god. God is love. Love is not God. Love is from God. Love is of God. Love is not God. Reference: John 13:34-35
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Unpacking Love - Part 1
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Unpacking Love - Part 1
item.itunes:summary: What is Love? 1 Corinthians 13 helps us understand what God's definition of love is and how it applies to our daily lives. Reference: 1 Corinthians 13:1-8
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Open Heart Surgery
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate Marriner
item.itunes:subtitle: Open Heart Surgery
item.itunes:summary: God doesn't want us to simply follow a bunch of rules or exercise a set of commands or actions, He wants a transformation of our heart. When our hearts are transformed, our lives are changed - not from outward actions but from an inner working that results in a different person on the outside. Reference: Proverbs 4:23
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Unstoppable - Part 3: Unstoppable Idiots
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Unstoppable - Part 3: Unstoppable Idiots
item.itunes:summary: In Acts, an event is described where Peter and John were brought before the Sanhedrin to explain a healing that had taken place. Peter and John are described as "ordinary," which in Greek means "an ignoramus, an ignorant or unlearned person, an idiot." This isn't describing them as an idiot like we think of an idiot today, but rather an idiot who simply believed that Jesus was who He said He was and that He did what He said He would do. By the world's standards, they were idiots. But regardless of how the world labels Christians, that is what God wants us to do - leave the world behind and be fully devoted to following Christ. When we truly live believing that Jesus is who He said and did what He said He would do, we will be unstoppable idiots. Reference: Acts 4:13
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Rethink: Family Ministry
item.itunes:author: Pastor Andy Rook
item.itunes:subtitle: Rethink: Family Ministry
item.itunes:summary: Family Ministry leader, Pastor Andy Rook, shares his vision for Family Ministry at Grace Church. Reference: Revelation 1:19-20; Leviticus 24:1-6; Revelation 2:4-5
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Unstoppable - Part 2: Unstoppable Partners
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Unstoppable - Part 2: Unstoppable Partners
item.itunes:summary: As Christians and the church of Christ, we can't let ambition, greed, jealousy, or anything else distract us from God's purpose for His church. We cannot afford to be sidetracked in our mission. When we pull together, stay focused on our mission and stay united in purpose, we are unstoppable partners! Reference: Matthew 16:18; Acts 2:42-47
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: The Grace Of God
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Shirey
item.itunes:subtitle: The Grace Of God
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Corrie Shirey have been ministering among Muslims since 2003. As speakers of Arabic, their hearts are for the Arabs, but God has given them love and compassion for Muslims everywhere. They seek to reach Muslims through evangelism, training, and discipleship. This week at Grace Church, Jonathan shares a message about experiencing the Grace of God. Reference: Exodus 34
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Unstoppable - Part 1: Unstoppable Mission
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Unstoppable - Part 1: Unstoppable Mission
item.itunes:summary: Jesus described His church as an unstoppable, prevailing force in our world. The church described by Jesus has a mandate to go into the world and make disciples - that is, to lead people to faith in Christ, and to nurture and grow them to maturity. God's church, when made up of Christians who have had a fundamental change in heart, is unstoppable. Reference: Matthew 16:18; Acts 2:42-47
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Life
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Life
item.itunes:summary: Greek philosophers long ago debated the logos or reason for life. The more they debated and thought about it, the closer they came to the conclusion that there really was no meaning. But God's Word tells a different story about our reason for existence. God created us. We are here for a purpose. There is a reason for life. John said that Jesus is the Logos. In Him is life! To help you know the reason for life, the Logos broke into time and became like us so we could know Him, love Him, and serve Him. We exist for Him! Reference: John 1:1-4,14
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Blessed (with a burden)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Blessed (with a burden)
item.itunes:summary: When Nehemiah heard word about the destruction of Israel, he received a tremendous gift from God that forever changed his life. His heart broke because God's heart was broken. He felt it deep within his bones - in his soul. This was a divine burden - a burden of love. This wasn't a burden you ask God to take from you. For those, we pray and invite God to intercede on behalf of these burdens. This was a burden for which you ask God to use you. This is where we pray and God invites us to intercede and make a difference. What kind of burden of love do you carry? Ask God for a burden of love and use this blessing to make a difference in your life and someone else's. Reference: Nehemiah 1:1-4
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Peace
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Peace
item.itunes:summary: Some people fasten their peace on their jobs, finances, leaders, spouses, etc. Ultimately, peace isn't found in any of these things - no matter how good they might be. Jesus said that real peace is found only in Him and describes this real peace as not of this world. It is not normal or natural. It is from God. While it is freely given, it cost a great price. Thankfully, Jesus didn't wait for us to pay the price. He paid it Himself. Reference: John 14:27; 16:33
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Happiness
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Happiness
item.itunes:summary: Being happy doesn't mean you don't go through seasons of life. Being happy doesn't mean that problems in your life don't impact you. Being happy doesn't mean you don't feel the pains of life. Of course you do. Character determines happiness and character comes from putting God first and and making Him the chief and overriding principle for life. Happiness is not found in circumstances, but rather in character. Reference: Psalm 1:1-6
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Eternity
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Eternity
item.itunes:summary: God puts eternity into our hearts to lead us to Him. It manifests in our questions: Why am I here? What is my purpose in life? Where do I come from? What is the meaning of life? Salmon swim upstream. Ducks fly south. Butterflies migrate. Eternity is hard-wired in us and leads us to something beyond here and now; not only something, but Someone - greater, transcendent, eternal, and loving. Reference: Ecclesiastes 3:11
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: The Story of Christmas
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: The Story of Christmas
item.itunes:summary: God sent Jesus to be born and die for us because we are sinners and we can't save ourselves. If we could do something - anything - to save ourselves, then there would have been no need for Jesus to die for us. But God loved us and reached out to us with His Son because while we couldn't save ourselves, He could. All we have to do is recognize that we are helpless sinners and accept the gift of Jesus. This is the Story of Christmas. Reference: Matthew 1:18-25
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: I Believe In You - Part 4
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In You - Part 4
item.itunes:summary: We all have our faults and sometimes we may feel like everyone has given up on us - no one believes in us. We may even feel that way about ourselves. We have to remember that God has not given up on us. No matter what we have done or will do, God still believes in us, and because Jesus made a difference, so can we. Reference: Isaiah 53:2-6
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: I Believe In You - Part 3
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In You - Part 3
item.itunes:summary: In Judges, we are told that as a new generation of Israelites grew up, they didn't know the Lord or what He had done for Israel in the past. We have to be careful not to let this happen with our generation. We are called to be spiritual fathers and mothers. We need to pass on to the next generation the stories and examples of how God has influenced and worked in our lives. We can all benefit and be encouraged by God's impact in the lives of our brothers and sisters in Christ. Reference: Judges 2:10
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: I Believe In You - Part 2
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In You - Part 2
item.itunes:summary: Our children see us doing a lot of things: watching sports, shopping, working, eating out, doing yard work, etc. Do our children ever see us praying, reading our bible, or sharing our faith? If you want God to be important to your children, God must be important to you. We must love God supremely to effectively impress the command to love God on our children. Reference: Psalm 71:18; Deuteronomy 6:4-9
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: I Believe In You - Part 1
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: I Believe In You - Part 1
item.itunes:summary: Our generation has been noted as being the most cause-driven, mission-minded generation in modern history. As part of God's family, we have to remember that we are not the church of tomorrow. We are not supposed to be "on deck" waiting for our "turn at bat." Our time is now. Don't let fear hold you back from letting God use you. We are not the church of tomorrow - we are the church of today. Reference: 1 Timothy 4:12; 1 Corinthians 11:1
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Courageous - Part 4: Lone Wolf Versus Team Player
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Courageous - Part 4: Lone Wolf Versus Team Player
item.itunes:summary: We were not created to be lone wolves. This goes against the grain of how we were created. We were created for community. We need one another. God has called His church, that is Christians in the church, to live in unity and harmony with one another - to show compasssion - to love one another. Reference: 1 Peter 3:8
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Courageous - Part 3: Fighters Versus Flyers
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate Marriner
item.itunes:subtitle: Courageous - Part 3: Fighters Versus Flyers
item.itunes:summary: The story of David and Goliath is familiar to many people. When facing Goliath, David recognized that God had a plan and would defeat the Philistines and he chose to stand and fight. When giants arise in our marriage and family life, we need to stand up and fight our battles with the promises of God. Reference: 1 Samuel 17
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Courageous - Part 2: Warriors Versus Wimps
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Courageous - Part 2: Warriors Versus Wimps
item.itunes:summary: There are many cases today where families have been abandoned by a father or mother for various reasons. God, however, does not abandon us. He chooses to transform and strengthen us. When we are completely broken and consumed, we are useful to God. Reference: Joshua 24:15; Judges 6
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Courageous - Part 1: Courageous Versus Complacent
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Courageous - Part 1: Courageous Versus Complacent
item.itunes:summary: Absent dads. Busy moms. Rebellious children. Faith that doesn't make a difference. Our world is looking for heroes...people of courage who will fearlessly stand for and do what is right. Throughout the Bible we find God speaking to ordinary people calling them to courageous living. The men and women who responded and obeyed made a difference in their world. You can too. Join us as we explore what it means to be courageous. Reference: Genesis 12:1-4; Hebrews 11:8
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Discerning God's Will - Part 5: Deny Yourself
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Discerning God's Will - Part 5: Deny Yourself
item.itunes:summary: In Luke, Jesus says, "For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me will save it. What good is it for a man to gain the whole world, and yet lose or forfeit his very self?" Jesus places such a value on our lives that he came to earth to die and save us. All we have to do is receive Him into our hearts; however, this means we must deny ourselves. We must put God first, and not our earthly wants and desires. Only then will we truly be saved. Reference: James 2:14; Luke 9:23-25
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Discerning God's Will - Part 4: Giving Thanks
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Discerning God's Will - Part 4: Giving Thanks
item.itunes:summary: Give thanks in all circumstances, for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you! Giving thanks is easy when things are good; however, it can be difficult when things aren't. We can give thanks because God is in control. Place your trust and confidence in God, follow His will for your life, and give Him thanks. Reference: 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Discerning God's Will - Part 3: Prayer
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Discerning God's Will - Part 3: Prayer
item.itunes:summary: When we fail to pray, we are not only missing out on finding help in times of trouble, we are ignoring the command of God to pray continually, which is for our benefit. If you find yourself overwhelmed, at the end of your rope, or at wits end - if you find that you don't know which way to turn, what decision to make, which way to go - if life is putting more on you than you can handle - pray! Pray continually. This is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you. Reference: 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Discerning God's Will - Part 2: When You're Under Pressure
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Discerning God's Will - Part 2: When You're Under Pressure
item.itunes:summary: How do you consider trials? Are they opportunities to moan, groan, and complain? Are they opportunities to walk around with a black cloud over your head? That is not God's will for you or me. James tells us to count adversities, trials, and difficulties as pure joy. Why? Because they are opportunities for joy. God uses trials to develop our perseverance and to mature our faith. The joy of what God is doing in you and the joy of what you will become will carry you through the difficulty you are facing. Reference: 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Discerning God's Will
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Discerning God's Will
item.itunes:summary: How can you discern what God's will is for your life. Paul gives us some steps to follow in order to do this: Offer yourself to God whole-heartedly, pattern your life after Christ, and be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Reference: Romans 12:1-2
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Weird - Part 6: Weird Sex
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Weird - Part 6: Weird Sex
item.itunes:summary: Our bodies were created to glorify and honor God; therefore, as Paul writes, we are not to commit sexual immorality. Rather, we are to unite ourselves with the Lord and be one with Him in spirit. This doesn't meant that God is against sex; however, it does mean that God has boundaries and conditions for how we are to engage in sex. Reference: Genesis 2:24-25; 1 Corinthians 6
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Weird - Part 5: A Weird View of Money
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Weird - Part 5: A Weird View of Money
item.itunes:summary: Gratitude brings contentment. Many times we think that if I get this I will experience contentment and then be grateful. The Bible teaches us to be grateful for what we have. In doing so, we find contentment, something money can never buy. Weird people enjoy the things God gives them, seeing these things as blessings to be enjoyed. Reference: Luke 12:42-43; Matthew 6:19-21; Ecclesiastes 5:10
item.itunes:keywords: Finance, Financials, Debt, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Weird - Part 4: Weird Way to Save the World
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Weird - Part 4: Weird Way to Save the World
item.itunes:summary: Jesus was different, weird, in many ways when compared to sinful man, but Jesus was God's weird way to save man from eternal death. Why would Jesus agree to die on the cross to save us? So that we could have a right standing with God - to restore our broken relationship with God the Father, our Creator. Reference: Philippians 3:4-9
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Weird - Part 3: Weird Desires
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Weird - Part 3: Weird Desires
item.itunes:summary: Would you trade your future for a bowl of stew? Sadly, normal people do it all the time. Untamed passions and the lack of self-control cause many to sacrifice their family, finances, faith in God, and future because of their unchecked desires. It's time to get Weird Desires, because normal isn't working. Reference: 1 John 2:15-17
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Weird - Part 2: Weird Is Better
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Weird - Part 2: Weird Is Better
item.itunes:summary: Becoming obsessed with what people think is the quickest way to forget God and what God thinks. Are you passionately pursuing God and a life that pleases Him? It's time for us to stop being led by our fear of man. It is time we start trusting God. Weird is better when God is in it! Reference: 1 Peter 1:14-16
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Weird - Part 1: Weird In A God Way
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Weird - Part 1: Weird In A God Way
item.itunes:summary: Are you sick of normal? Are you sick of being tired, overwhelmed, stressed out, broke, or miserable? Are you sick and tired of normal Christianity - Christianity that doesn't cost you anything or require anything of you? Jesus taught otherwise! Are you sick and tired of normal living - getting more and more, filling your life with more and more, but finding yourself more and more empty? If you want what normal people have, do what normal people do. If you want what few people have, do what few people do. Get weird in a God way! Reference: Matthew 7:13-14
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: You Lose If Anger Wins
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate Marriner
item.itunes:subtitle: You Lose If Anger Wins
item.itunes:summary: When dealing with anger, people often fall into two categories. Those who explode on the spot, and those who push the anger deep inside and usually explode over something else later on. In Matthew, Jesus tells us that we sin regardless of whether we commit the act outwardly or only in our hearts. So even though someone who holds their anger in may think they are being obedient to Christ, they really are just sinning in their heart, just as someone who explodes is sinning outwardly. We need to learn to deal with anger by spending time with God. We need to ask ourselves, "Why am I angry?" and "Who can help me?" Without taking these steps to get control of our anger, we can never fully be the person Christ wants us to be and achieve all that He wants us to achieve. Reference: Matthew 5:21-22
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Freedom
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Freedom
item.itunes:summary: Truth gives us boundaries in which to live and enjoy life. Paul reminds us that the truth to live by, the constraining truth, is love. We find freedom in truth; however, freedom without love leads to lawlessness (do whatever you want to do) or legalism (do whatever I tell you to do). Freedom governed by love changes everything. It is only love that can transform a sinful, selfish, and self-centered person. Love doesn't seek its own good, but rather the good of others. Love doesn't puff up itself. It builds up others. Truth brings freedom, freedom comes from truth, and truth makes us free. Reference: Galatians 5:13-14
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: In Name Only?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Nate Marriner
item.itunes:subtitle: In Name Only?
item.itunes:summary: All we are and all we have is only through the grace of God. This is the truth and if we really believe this, how can we be self-righteous and try to uplift ourselves by looking for glory from our own works? Search your heart today and look for any area where God is not glorified - any area where you try to exalt yourself instead of our Lord and Savior. Reference: Luke and Acts
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Father's Day
item.itunes:author: Terry Whittenton
item.itunes:subtitle: Father's Day
item.itunes:summary: This week guest speaker Terry Whittenton brings a special Father's Day message and challenge for fathers.
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Ghost - Part 5: The Fruit of the Spirit
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Ghost - Part 5: The Fruit of the Spirit
item.itunes:summary: Jesus said that a person can be recognized by the fruit they produce. The fruit of the Spirit doesn't come from behavior modification, it comes from character transformation. We don't need to get our sin under control, we need to crucify it. By doing this, we will have the fruit of the Spirit that remains and lasts in our life. Reference: Galatians 5:22-25
item.itunes:keywords: Ghost, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Ghost - Part 4: The Spirit-filled Life
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Ghost - Part 4: The Spirit-filled Life
item.itunes:summary: We are all filling our lives with something. We can easily tell what fills our lives by checking our calendar, our checkbook, and our thoughts. Do these things reflect the Holy Spirit, or do they show selfish desires and short-term pleasures? God wants the Holy Spirit to fill our lives because whatever fills us, will control us. Review your inner-most desires, get rid of the temporary pleasures of this earth and replace them with the things of God as the Holy Spirit fills you more each day. Reference: Ephesians 5:15-18
item.itunes:keywords: Ghost, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Ghost - Part 3: The Gifts of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Ghost - Part 3: The Gifts of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:summary: When we confess Jesus Christ as Savior and Lord, the Holy Spirit indwells us and gives to us spiritual gifts. These spiritual gifts are given so that we may glorify and honor Jesus Christ and help one another. As Christians, we need to find out what our spiritual gifts are and use them as God desired. Reference: 1 Corinthians 12:1,4-7
item.itunes:keywords: Ghost, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Ghost - Part 2: The Power of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Ghost - Part 2: The Power of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:summary: The Holy Spirit gives us power to share Christ boldly, to be strong when we are weak, to have hope, and to experience all the fullness of God. These are the promises of God regarding the Holy Spirit in a Christian's life. Reference: Acts 1:4-5,8
item.itunes:keywords: Ghost, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Ghost - Part 1: The Presence of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Ghost - Part 1: The Presence of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:summary: The Trinity is made up of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost. The Father and Son are fairly easy for us to grasp; however, the Holy Ghost, or Holy Spirit, is a little harder to understand. Jesus said he sent the Holy Spirit for our good - for our benefit. Jesus called Him the Counselor, which when translated, means the Holy Spirit will be our Intercessor, Consoler, Advocate, Comforter, and Helper. Reference: John 14:16-17; John 16:7
item.itunes:keywords: Ghost, Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Living Water
item.itunes:author: Shelly Brown Boyette
item.itunes:subtitle: Living Water
item.itunes:summary: This week for Mother's Day, Shelly Brown Boyette shares a special message on serving in God's Kingdom and giving the Living Water from Jesus Christ to our kids through our own lives. Reference: Psalm 91:4
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Real Love - Part 2: Acceptance and Rejection
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Real Love - Part 2: Acceptance and Rejection
item.itunes:summary: We go through life looking for a place where we fit in and belong. We want people to love us and welcome us for who we are and the way we are. We know we aren't perfect and that we won't always agree. Still we search for a place to "hang our hat." We look for a place where we are accepted. Acceptance is the patent expression of unconditional and sacrificial love, but acceptance is not an attachment to a behavior, it is an attachment to a person. Acceptance is not, however, an approval of bad behavior. We accept a person, but we may not approve of his choices, lifestyle, or behavior. For the person being accepted, and loved, the fear of rejection is removed. This is how Christ loves us, and because of this perfect love, God accepts us into His family, despite our behavior and sins. Reference: Romans 15:7
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon

item.title: Real Love
item.itunes:author: Pastor Rob Keffer
item.itunes:subtitle: Real Love
item.itunes:summary: Real love is unconditional and sacrificial. Real love sacrifices comfort, possessions, and time. God loved us and sent Jesus to redeem us. Jesus commanded us to love others - really love others - unconditionally and sacrificially. What can you give for the benefit of others? Reference: John 3:16; 1 John 3:16
item.itunes:keywords: Love, Grace, Mercy, Faith, Christ, Jesus, Church, God, Christianity, Sermon
